note.p: Death Place: Edward Street, Portman Square, London (08 January 1830)
Education: Exeter College, Oxford. BA (1768); MA (1770); BD (1782)

Career: Vicar of Mamhead, Devon (1777); Rector of Little Hempston, near Totnes until he resigned the living (1784-1790); in Paris during the Revolution, and after the Treaty of Amiens (1791-1792 and 1802); wrote oriental translations, travel and theological books
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1830-1831 No 1 p 10
